title: Add Daily Pollution content (public browsing + admin management)

requirements.text: Add a new backend content model and persistent store for “Daily Pollution” entries, where each entry is tied to a specific calendar day (using the existing numeric day-key approach) and can be listed publicly without authentication.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend defines a stable DailyPollutionEntry type with at least: id, day, title, description, optional sourceUrl (or equivalent URL field).
Backend persists DailyPollutionEntry items in a dedicated store (similar persistence approach to other content stores).
Backend exposes public query methods to list all pollution entries and to list pollution entries by day key.
Anonymous (unauthenticated) callers can successfully read pollution entries.

requirements.text: Implement admin-only write operations for Daily Pollution entries in the backend, using the existing allowlist-based admin authorization rule used for other admin write operations.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes admin-guarded methods to create and delete Daily Pollution entries.
Non-admin callers attempting to create/delete Daily Pollution entries receive an Unauthorized error.
After successful create/delete, subsequent reads reflect the changes.

requirements.text: Seed the Daily Pollution backend store with a small starter set of entries spanning multiple different days so the feature can be tested end-to-end immediately after deployment.
acceptanceCriteria: At least 5 seeded Daily Pollution entries exist across at least 3 distinct day keys.
Seeded entries have meaningful English titles and descriptions and do not use placeholder-only text like 'test' or 'lorem ipsum'.
The public UI (REQ-34) shows seeded entries for the matching days without requiring login.

requirements.text: Add a new public landing-page section named “Daily Pollution” that lets users (including anonymous users) browse pollution entries by day (using the same day selector UX pattern as the existing Daily Test Series section), including loading, error, and empty states.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page displays a “Daily Pollution” section with a day selector for recent days and a list of entries for the selected day.
Section shows a loading indicator while fetching, a clear error alert on failure, and a clear empty-state message when no entries exist for the selected day.
All user-facing text in this section is English.
Anonymous users can view the section and its contents.

requirements.text: Extend the existing Admin Content Manager page to support creating and deleting Daily Pollution entries, using the same admin-guard behavior and UX patterns as existing content management tabs.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin Content Manager includes a new tab/mode for “Daily Pollution”.
Admins can add a pollution entry by selecting a date and providing required fields; successful submission clears the form and refreshes the list.
Admins can delete a pollution entry with a confirmation prompt; successful deletion refreshes the list.
Non-admin users cannot access the admin manager page functionality (existing AdminGuard behavior remains intact).

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor with all logic in backend/main.mo.
Create backend/migration.mo changes only if required to preserve existing canister state (conditional migration policy).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.frontend.immutablePaths.
All user-facing text must be in English.
nonGoals: Do not add real-time pollution feeds, external API integrations, or geolocation-based pollution data.
Do not implement notifications or push alerts for daily pollution updates.
Do not change existing Study Material, Previous Year Papers, Current Affairs, or Daily Test Series behaviors except as needed to integrate the new section/tab.
